documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: city 's £ 50m flood defence scheme opens
text: city 's £ 50m flood defence scheme opens

documents.title: mothballed steel equipment reinstated
text: mothballed steel equipment reinstated

documents.title: sex accused vicar died during 'meltdown ' over charges
text: a former bradford vicar who killed himself a day before he was due to appear in court to face sex assault charges had a `` meltdown '' , an inquest heard .
trevor devamanikkam , 70 , from witney in oxfordshire , failed to appear at bradford magistrates ' court on 6 june .
he was charged with six counts of sexual abuse , said to have taken place between march 1984 and april 1985 .
a coroner concluded the accusations had caused him `` huge anxiety '' and he had intended to take his own life .

documents.title: killers jailed for decades over addict 's violent death
text: two men from rotherham have been jailed for decades after they murdered a drug addict in his own home to steal his wallet .
stephen fretwell 's body was found lying underneath the windowsill in the bedroom of his ground floor flat in december last year .
the 47-year-old had been violently beaten and left with broken bones and cuts , police described his injuries as `` horrific '' .
neighbours told police that they had thought someone had been tortured .
barry plant , 36 , of sandymount road , wath-upon-dearne was jailed for 30 years today at sheffield crown court .
nathan fensome , 28 of no fixed abode was jailed for 27 years .
stephen was my baby , always was and always will be and words can not describe the loss and loneliness i feel today ''

documents.title: charity can not offer shelter for homeless youngsters
text: one of rotherham 's oldest charities , rush house has announced it will no longer be able to offer accommodation to homeless young people .
the organisation , based on doncaster road , has lost more than £ 300,000 in funding after council contracts were awarded to other charities .
the charity says although it will no longer offer accommodation , it will continue to offer support to 18-24 year olds relating to education , training and employment .
we 've been here for 30 years and we 'll stay open to support vulnerable young people into work ''

documents.title: city 's £ 50m flood defence scheme opens
text: city 's £ 50m flood defence scheme opens

documents.title: police want to speak to these people - do you know them ?
text: do you know any of these people ?
they could be able to help in a investigation after the death of a homeless man in leeds in august .
police say they want to speak to any of the people in the above as they might have seen something which could help the investigation .
terry bailey , 39 , who was believed to be sleeping rough , was assaulted in the early hours of tuesday , and died in hospital a short time later .
two men have been charged with manslaughter in connection with the death .

documents.title: tallest building plans submitted
text: tallest building plans submitted

documents.title: golf club targeted by quad bike vandals six times since august
text: a golf club in leeds says it 's been plagued by people riding motorbikes and quad bikes on the course .
south leeds golf club in middleton says that they have been targeted by vandals six times in the last two months .
when the course has been ridden on they have to close the area , meaning they 're losing cash .
the club say that at this time of year it can take more than a month to get the ground back to a playable standard .
west yorkshire police said it was `` unacceptable damage at south leeds golf club .
if you know who is using off road bikes anti socially or where they are stored let us know . ''

documents.title: armed police called after gate rammed and gun fired in leeds
text: armed police were called in leeds last night after a car rammed the gates of a house and a shotgun was fired .
shortly after 23:00 police say they were called to hawthorne drive in gildersome , there were no injures and an audi drove off towards gelderd road .
shortly after the audi was set on fire at cottingley springs caravan site .
police say that the people involved in what happened know each other and that they were targeted attacks .
we are working closely with our colleagues at leeds district who have increased their patrols of the areas to reassure the community ''

documents.title: knives and blades handed in to police
text: knives , scissors and even a potato peeler were among the bladed items handed in at woodseats police station in sheffield yesterday .
south yorkshire police is taking part in the drop the knife campaign and is urging people to hand over weapons after three stabbings that took place in sheffield city centre at the weekend .
think about the consequences of carrying a knife before you up a weapon and leave home with it ''

documents.title: do you know courtney jenkins ? she is missing
text: police from south yorkshire are looking for 13-year-old courtney jenkins who was reported missing at around 14:00 yesterday .
she was last seen at around 17:30 in the parson cross area of sheffield .
despite extensive inquiries officers have been unable to find her .
anyone with information is asked to contact police .

documents.title: a breath of fresh air in parts of harrogate ?
text: work to improve air quality in two parts of the harrogate district is about to get under way .
the authority is putting together plans for york place , in knaresborough and at the woodlands junction on wetherby road , harrogate .
both areas have exceeded national targets for traffic-related nitrogen dioxide .
harrogate borough council is now obliged to show the government how they are going to improve the air quality .

documents.title: pupils 'terrified ' of new school rules
text: pupils 'terrified ' of new school rules

documents.title: witness appeal after serious crash in doncaster
text: a 48-year-old man 's suffered serious injuries after an accident on bawtry road , doncaster .
a white bmw 320 and black vauxhall zafira collided with each other on the a614 bawtry road , near to the hatfield junction with moor dike road at around 07:30 on thursday 28 september ,
the driver of the zafira was taken to hospital to receive treatment .
an investigation has been launched into the incident and officers are appealing for any witnesses .

documents.title: barnsley 's ryan hedges to join wales squad
text: barnsley striker ryan hedges is celebrating his first senior call-up at international level after marley watkins withdrew from the wales squad because of injury .
wales play georgia in tbilisi on friday in the world cup qualifiers before their final group game against the republic of ireland three days later .
barnsley 's tom bradshaw was called up to the squad yesterday as a replacement for gareth bale following his calf injury .

documents.title: 'fish salesman ' took money from woman 's home
text: an elderly lady has had cash taken from her home by a man claiming to be selling fish .
the incident happened on monday lunchtime in kirkburton near huddersfield when a man went to the woman 's house telling her he had fish for sale .
the man got inside her house uninvited , took some of her money and - according to police - left `` a small amount of food in the fridge '' before he went .
the suspect is white , approximately 50-years-old , 5ft tall , dark hair which was thinning on top , spoke with a yorkshire accent and wearing a white apron .
if you are unsure always ask for official identification or a contact telephone number .
never feel under pressure , you are under no obligation ''

documents.title: arrest after ryedale anti-fracking protester mounts scaffold lorry
text: anti-fracking protesters say they shut down the yard of a whitby-based scaffolding company earlier today due to the company 's involvement in fracking in ryedale .
they arrived at the yard of sky scaffolding early this morning to hold a protest .
for the last two-weeks , campaigners have been calling for the company to stand with the local community by stopping work at third energy 's kirby misperton fracking site .
the kirby misperton protection group say at about 07:00 , `` during a slow walk protest , a large lorry was mounted , blocking the gateway to the yard '' .
they say an anti-fracking protester remained on the lorry until 11:45 , `` when the company took an angle grinder to their own fence in order to create an alternative route out of the yard .
`` at this point the surfer dismounted by his own free will . ''

police say they spoke to the 21-year-old man and when he climbed down he was arrested on `` sus of using violence or intimidation on a person , family or property to compel abstention from lawful activity '' and `` aggravated trespass '' .
the man remains in custody at this time .

documents.title: could yorkshire be getting a new tallest building ?
text: leeds could soon be home to a new city centre building which would be the tallest in yorkshire .
plans for the ceg south bank have been submitted to leeds city council and work on it could start as early as next summer .
ceg , who also built the kirkstall forge development , want to redevelop a site near globe road which could include a tower which is 40 storeys high .
currently , yorkshire 's tallest building - also in leeds - is bridgewater place , which stands at 32 storeys high .
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: litter louts in sheffield fined almost £ 7,000
text: a total of 17 people have been prosecuted in the last week after they failed to pay an £ 80 fixed penalty fine for littering , according to sheffield city council .
sheffield magistrates ' court imposed fines of £ 200 on each offender along with costs of £ 160 , as well as a victim surcharge of £ 30 .

sheffield city council 's environmental enforcement officers have issued 647 notices to litter louts across the city in the last 12 months , with the majority opting to pay the fixed penalty , the authority says .

documents.title: leigh sign crooks after loan spell
text: leigh sign crooks after loan spell

documents.title: listen : introducing tour reaches billie marten in ripon
text: a musical marathon is being held across north yorkshire today celebrating 10-years of bbc introducing , which supports unsigned , undiscovered and under the radar music across the uk .
radio york introducing presenter , jericho keys , is on a 12-hour road trip , that will take in 12 locations and 12 live music performances .
billie marten was discovered on the show .
she released her first ep at the age of 15 in 2014 , and her second ep a year later .
at the end of 2015 she was nominated for the bbc sound of 2016 award .
she 's been playing live in ripon this morning :

documents.title: yorkshire air ambulance to carry blood supplies
text: yorkshire air ambulance will be able to carry stocks of blood on board for the first time , meaning they can give life-saving blood transfusions .
the step comes after a donation of £ 16,000 from the henry surtees foundation , which was founded by motor sport legend john surtees cbe , following the death of his son henry .
henry died in 2009 during a f2 race at brands hatch aged 18 , the grant has funded specially-designed temperature-controlled boxes so blood can be transported and stored .
the blood will only be available on one of the two helicopters to begin with .
people with traumatic injuries are at greater risk from bleeding to death so having blood available on the air ambulance will benefit those patients ''

documents.title: stabbing murder accused in court
text: stabbing murder accused in court

documents.title: woman , 74 , attacked in broad daylight in city
text: a 74-year old woman has been attacked and robbed in broad daylight in bradford on monday .
police have released a cctv image and want to speak to anyone who saw a person dressed like this in the area .
the victim 's handbag was stolen during the robbery , which happened at lunchtime at the junction of low green terrace and southfield lane .
officers are questioning a 30-year-old man about the attack .

documents.title: £ 50k drugs seized in sheffield house raid
text: police have recovered heroin and crack cocaine worth an estimated £ 50k when they raided a house in burngreave , sheffield .
an undisclosed amount of cash was also found at the address on holtwood road .
a 21-year-old man has been charged with possession of class a drugs with intent to supply .
he 's also charged with possession of a bladed article following the seizure of a large combat knife earlier this year .
he 's due to appear before magistrates today .

documents.title: bradford air stewardess 'truly heartbroken ' after being made redundant
text: a former air stewardess at monarch airlines from bradford has expressed her sadness following the airline 's collapse .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: 12 men charged in rotherham child sex abuse investigation
text: twelve men aged between 33 and 38 are due to appear in court later this month charged with 44 child sexual abuse offences in south yorkshire .
they were arrested as part of the national crime agency 's operation stovewood which was launched in the wake of the rotherham grooming scandal .
the charges include rape , indecent assault , supply of controlled drugs and false imprisonment .
the charges are related to the sexual abuse of eight girls under the age of 16 , over a five-year period from 1998 to 2003 .
all will appear at sheffield magistrates court on the 24 october 2017 .

documents.title: watch : steel firm creates 64 jobs in rotherham
text: a steel firm in south yorkshire has created 64 jobs by bringing a mothballed piece of equipment back into service .
liberty special steels in rotherham hopes to increase its production of high grade steel for automotive and engineering sectors .
the firm hopes there will be more vacancies in the new year when a second piece of equipment is due to be brought back into service .
author: Kat Cowan
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather warning for strong winds across yorkshire
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for strong winds overnight for yorkshire , with potential for some disruption to transport and power .

documents.title: police search for car after three hurt in bradford crash
text: three men were left seriously injured after a car crash in bradford yesterday evening and police are looking for another car that may have been involved .
the accident happened at about 19:40 when a black vw golf was driving along thornton road towards thornton , when it collided with a silver nissan micra at the junction with rosse street .
the three men in their 20s from both cars were taken to hospital but their injures are n't life threatening .
police say that they think the golf may have been `` travelling in convoy '' with another car and they want to find the third vehicle .

documents.title: well dressed but 'aisle ' be glad to see you go
text: a north yorkshire woman 's selling her wedding dress online declaring it 's in a stunning condition , unlike , she says , her marriage .
jane posted the dress online asking people to help her remove the £ 800 outfit from her life .
she says `` all bad luck has been removed as post separation the dress was cleaned .
`` i know this because after dry cleaning i became happier and more confident , realizing what it was like to be treated well in a relationship ''
jane insists whoever buys it need n't be getting married .
she says : `` the dress would look great on many different occasions : while your washing the dishes or standing to catch a train , or even standing in line to do a name change . ''

documents.title: watch : from the air - leeds £ 50m flood defence system
text: a £ 50m flood defence project officially opens later in leeds , with state-of-the-art moveable weirs .
more than 3000 homes and businesses were badly affected by floodwater in 2015 , when the river aire reached unprecedented levels .
the leeds central labour mp , hilary benn says it 's great to celebrate phase one , but `` more work is needed to protect the city and surrounding areas . ''
here 's a bird's-eye view of the new system :

documents.title: in sunsets over yorkshire
text: last night 's sunset over yorkshire seems to have been pretty spectacular wherever you were .
our bbc weather watchers were quick to capture the sunlight 's scattered rays .
to generate an intensively red sky there has to be lots of water droplets in the air .
the sky in the west has to be clear with a lot of clouds in the east too .

documents.title: listen : green party leader - fracking in north yorkshire 'an unnecessary risk '
text: york labour mp , rachael maskell , is due to visit north yorkshire 's fracking site in ryedale later .
she 'll be joined in kirby misperton by members of thirsk and malton labour party , who say fracking will damage the local economy and environment .
the scottish government announced a ban on fracking yesterday , saying the practice `` can not and will not take place in scotland . ''
but third energy says fracking is safe and it will start test drilling for shale gas by the end of the year .
rachael maskell 's visit follows a trip to kirby misperton by jonathan bartley , co-leader of the green party .
he says fracking is an unnecessary risk :

documents.title: barnsley school discipline is 'breeding fear ' say parents
text: penistone grammar in barnsley is defending its discipline policy .
parents have complained that pupils are put into isolation for not tucking their shirt in or for forgetting a pen .
some of them say it 's breeding an atmosphere of fear .

documents.title: travel : train services getting back to normal
text: disruption on services between sheffield , stockport and manchester now clearing .
cleared : disruption caused by signalling problems between # sheffield and # chinley has now ended .
trains are now able to run through # edale but may still be disrupted as services return to normal .

documents.title: listen : leeds it company fighting extremist online content
text: online technology experts in leeds say they 're helping to lead the fight against extremist content on social media .
it comes after home secretary , amber rudd , proposed new punishments for people who repeatedly looked at terrorist material online , in addition to those who own or download it .
adam hildreth is the founder of crisp thinking , a leeds-based firm who 've created artificially intelligent software , which finds the sources of offensive content online .
he says rooting out extremist content is a huge challenge :

documents.title: introducing a 10-year tour :
text: a unique musical marathon is being held across north yorkshire today celebrating 10-years of bbc introducing - which supports unsigned , undiscovered and under the radar music across the uk .
radio york introducing presenter , jericho keys , is on a 12-hour road trip that will take in 12 locations and 12 live music performances .
you can hear each live performance throughout the day on bbc radio york .
here 's who'se playing where , when !

documents.title: sheffield shop targeted in morning ram-raid
text: a car was driven into the eton designer outlet on division street , in the city centre , at about 6am .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: from that to this : autumn arrives in york 's clarence gardens
text: how 's this for a bit of autumnal magic ?
watch the leaves change colour in york 's clarence gardens .
ten days of gradual change in the blink of an eye :
author: Jonathan Cowap
Presenter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: listen : york citizens advice struggling to cope
text: the charity citizens advice in york says it 's still struggling to cope with people moving onto the government 's new universal credit and in some cases sessions are so busy it 's having to turn people away .
last month the city of york council voted to give the charity an extra £ 12,000 , because of increased demand linked to the switch to the new benefit system .
the charity told bbc radio york it held one session where more than 40 people were told to come back another day .
colin smith from acomb went to citizens advice for help :

documents.title: warning of west yorkshire care home crisis
text: it 's claimed west yorkshire 's care homes will be unable to keep up with demand by 2022 .
research by consumer group which ?
suggests there 'll be a shortfall of more than 1,500 hundred beds within the next five years .
the research looks at the likely demand for care home places by 2022 compared to the predicted number of beds available .
in bradford it suggests a shortfall of more than 600 and care homes in kirklees could be more than 400 places short .
the consumer group says almost nine out of 10 councils are likely to face this problem .
the local government association is again calling on ministers to come up with a national solution to the social care funding crisis .

documents.title: south yorkshire steelworks reignited
text: a furnace that was mothballed at a south yorkshire steelworks is being relit .
liberty steels took over the aldwarke plant in rotherham earlier this year .
and there are plans for a second and third furnace to be relit .
sixty four new staff have already been hired by liberty for the recommissioning of the small bloom caster , with a further 150 to be hired in the next six months .

documents.title: watch : yorkshire 's weather - bright at first , wet and windy later
text: a bright start followed by showers later today and very wet and windy tonight .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: labour mp visit to support anti-fracking protesters
text: york 's labour mp , rachael maskell , will visit north yorkshire 's fracking site in ryedale later .
third energy was given permission to frack in kirby misperton in 2016 .
protesters have been at the site since contractors and equipment started arriving last week .
the mp will be joined in kirby misperton by members of thirsk and malton labour party , who say fracking will damage the local economy and environment .
the scottish government announced a ban on fracking yesterday , saying the practice `` can not and will not take place in scotland '' .
but third energy says fracking is safe and it will start test drilling for shale gas by the end of the year .
rachael maskell 's visit follows a trip to kirby misperton by jonathan bartley , co-leader of the green party .

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: rail services across yorkshire appear to be running pretty much to time so far this morning .
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: leeds £ 50m flood scheme opens
text: a £ 50m flood defence system opens in leeds today .
the leeds flood alleviation scheme uses moveable weir technology , which means defence walls can be kept as low as possible .
it 's one of the largest in the country and extends almost three miles from leeds station to thwaits mills..
the new system will help protect more than 3,500 homes and businesses from flooding .

documents.title: listen : barnsley school discipline - 'blinkered , robotic and authoritarian '
text: a school in barnsley is defending its discipline policy which can see pupils being put into isolation for not tucking their shirt in or for forgetting a pen .
some parents say penistone grammar 's newly introduced scheme of values driven expectations is breeding an atmosphere of fear and will hit morale .
the school say the scheme is intended to reward good behaviour and deter poor discipline .
pupils get `` strikes '' for bad behaviour .
if they get six in one week they spend a day in isolation .
parent , mathew fenoughty , says it 's blinkered , robotic and authoritarian :

documents.title: here comes the rain again : yorkshire 's wednesday weather
text: after a dry start to the day , cloud will build through the morning with showery outbreaks of rain developing .
rain will continue for much of the evening , becoming heavy at times and accompanied by strong winds .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on wednesday 4 october 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport updates from across yorkshire .
autumn so far seems to be moving slowly , rather than dashing headlong into winter .
and that means we 've been able to start each day this week with glorious bbc weather watcher
today is no exception :
if you have a great pic to share , or want to get in touch with us about what 's happening where you are , just email us here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
